climbs.name: Troposphere
climbs.fa: Unknown. But first recorded by: John Vander Wyst, October 2020

content.description: Follow the large crack upwards to gain the first ledge. Traverse upwards and to the right along the ledge before completing a few more moves on the mossy slab face to gain the top out.
content.location: Around the corner of the first bulge of Lower MossLab the wall opens up to a large mossy slab face 10-15 ft wide between two bulges. This route starts up a large crack on the right

climbs.name: Stratosphere
climbs.fa: Unknown. First recorded by John Vander Wyst, November 2020

content.description: Start is the same as Troposphere, but after gaining the ledge continue straight up the slab rather than skirting around. Moderate slab moves may make your hands sweat 15-20 ft off the ground.

The Largest of the three MossLab areas with tons of room for more development. This area stretches around a curve at the bottom of Mid MossLab and opens up to large slabby walls with unique features, some overhung. Many of the highball boulders in this area may be considered closer to a short climb rather than just a boulder problem, but are quite rewarding to those bold enough face the challenge.
